title: Casual CT Tech
description:
About Children’s Minnesota

Children’s Minnesota is one of the largest pediatric health systems in the United States and the only health system in Minnesota to provide care exclusively to children, from before birth through young adulthood. An independent and not-for-profit system since 1924, Children’s Minnesota is one system serving kids throughout the Upper Midwest at two free-standing hospitals, nine primary care clinics, multiple specialty clinics and seven rehabilitation sites. As The Kids Experts™ in our region, Children’s Minnesota is regularly ranked by U.S. News & World Report as a top children’s hospital. Find us on Facebook @childrensminnesota or on Twitter and Instagram @childrensmn. Please visit childrensMN.org.

Children’s Minnesota is proud to be recognized by Modern Healthcare as one of 2023’s Top Diversity Leaders. The national honor recognizes the top diverse healthcare executives and organizations influencing public policy, care delivery, and promoting diversity, equity and inclusion in their organizations and the industry.

Position Summary

The CT Technologist is responsible for operating the CT scanning equipment to produce the images used by the Radiologists. The technologist orients the patient and family to the scan procedure and physically prepares and processes the patient through the study. The technologist prepares and assesses image quality and presents completed images to the Radiologist.
• ARRT certification as a radiologic technologist.
• Current Basic Life Support (BLS) certification required.
• Prior radiology experience preferred.

Career Pathing
Normally promoted from: Radiologic Technologist
May be promoted to: CT/MRI Technologist

The posted salary represents a market competitive range based on salary survey benchmark data for similar roles in the local or national market. When determining individual pay rates, we carefully consider a wide range of factors including but not limited to market indicators for the specific role, the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate, internal equity and organizational needs.

In addition to your salary, this position may be eligible for medical, dental, vision, retirement, and other fringe benefits. Positions that require night, weekend or on-call work may be eligible for shift differentials or premium pay.

All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of an occupational health assessment, drug screen, background investigation, and compliance with the U.S. Government Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification.

Children’s Minnesota is proud to be an equal opportunity employer whose staff is representative of its community and considers qualified applicants for open positions without regard to race, color, creed, sex, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: CT Technologist - Mayo Clinic Square
description:
About the position

The Radiologic Technologist position at Mayo Clinic involves producing high-quality images in accordance with the standards of the Radiology Department. The role requires proficiency in various imaging equipment and technology, adherence to safety guidelines, and effective communication to foster teamwork. The position is flexible, requiring the ability to work varied hours and shifts, including on-call responsibilities.

Responsibilities
• Produce high-quality images that meet established standards.
,
• Operate a variety of imaging equipment and technology.
,
• Practice safety guidelines for self, support personnel, and patients.
,
• Foster teamwork through effective communication.
,
• Maintain flexibility to staff various work locations and shift times.
,
• Respond to on-call pager, which may include days, evenings, nights, holidays, and weekends.

Requirements
• Must have an Associate's degree in a related field.
,
• Graduate of an accredited radiography program.
,
• Organized, efficient, and multifunctional.
,
• Ability to work independently.
,
• Excellent interpersonal skills and effective communication.
,
• ARRT certified in Radiography or registry eligible with certification obtained before start date of employment.
,
• Annual documentation of ARRT certification required.
,
• Obtain ARRT(CT) certification within 18 months of employment.
,
• CPR/BLS Certified or obtained within 90 days of employment.

Nice-to-haves

Benefits
• Competitive compensation
,
• Comprehensive benefit plans
,
• Continuing education opportunities
,
• Advancement opportunities

title: CT Scan Technician
description:
Required Skills and Qualifications
• Registration as a Certified Radiologic and Computerized Tomography Tech by the State.
• Registration as an RT and CT Technologist by the A.R.R.T.
• Valid hands-on CPR certification.

SimonMed Imaging values its employees and provides a safe and supportive work environment.

title: CT Technologist - ADIT - Sign on bonus starting at $4,000!
description:
Overview:

Fairview is hiring a CT Technologist to join our CT Scanner department at our M Health Fairview Southdale Hospital location in Edina, MN. This role is eligible for a sign on bonus up starting at $4,000!

At Southdale Hospital, we are known for our award-winning heart, stroke and cancer care. We offer 24/7 Imaging services to Inpatient Units and Emergency patients and we have outpatient access seven days a week. This position in the CT department would offer imaging care to in-patients, out-patients and emergent patients. The technologists work collaboratively within the Imaging team and amongst varying levels of clinical practitioners. The CT technologist will provide imaging services to a wide variety of examinations from Neuro, Body, Musculoskeletal, & Vascular. This position may be willing to cross-train into CT for those that do not have experience.

The CT Technologist functions independently based on the boundaries of professional practice in performing all major work responsibilities. The Technologist provides services to patients and physicians through the creation of high-quality diagnostic imaging, provides quality age-appropriate patient care according to established standards of practice, and works collaboratively with all members of the health care team. The technologist is responsible for performing the responsibilities in accordance with all policy, procedures, and regulatory agency requirements (ARRT).

Schedule: This position will be working 0.8 FTE (64 hours every two weeks). The shift length will be a mix of 8 & 12 hours, primarily assigned to the day shift. Positions within the department are not regularly scheduled to work weekends or take on call services.

A typical schedule will be:
• Week 1: Monday & Tuesday (8:30A-5P) returning Thursday & Friday (8A-8P)
• Week 2: Wednesday - Friday (8:30A-5P) resulting in an extended weekend every other week
• We are a 24/7 operation and employees may be asked to cover a critical shift if needed.

About Fairview:

Fairview is an industry-leading, award-winning nonprofit that offers an entire network of healthcare services. Fairview is one part of M Health Fairview, a partnership between the University of Minnesota, M Physicians and Fairview. Together, we combine the University’s deep history of clinical innovation and training with Fairview’s extensive roots in community medicine. Our care portfolio includes community hospitals, academic hospitals, primary and specialty care clinics, senior facilities, facilitated living centers, rehabilitation centers, home health care services, counseling, pharmacies, and benefit management services.

Apply today to join our 34,000+ employees and 5,000+ system providers working to build lasting relationships with the people we serve: our patients, our communities, and each other.

Responsibilities/Job Description:

As a CT Technologist, you will be responsible for:
• Maintaining and prioritizing work to achieve optimal patient outcomes.
• Performing excellent patient care and examinations.
• Using appropriate communication skills to meet patient/family, and other customer needs and communicating pertinent data clearly to the appropriate health care professional.
• Communicating with and educating patient regarding pertinent information during all aspects of exam.
• Achieving quality diagnostic images through correct patient positioning and use of technical factors according to protocol.
• Applying established professional guidelines and standards to complex, routine, and non-routine diagnostic testing procedures while ensuring patient data integrity.
• Adhering to radiologic safety guidelines and diagnostic testing protocols/procedures and accurately documenting in compliance with regulatory agency requirements, completing computer functions, edits, scheduling, and billing status changes.
• Assessing the validity of the test results to determine if consistent with changing physiological conditions or if due to possible interfering substances.
• Participating as an active team member and participating in department/facility process/quality improvement initiatives.
• Correctly operating equipment according to accepted standards and guidelines while identifying0 and responding to equipment problems to ensure equipment is working properly.
• Maintaining a high level of competency.
• Participating in Quality Assurance testing as required by regulatory agencies and/or manufacturer recommendations.

Qualifications:

Required Qualifications:
• Education
• Graduate of an accredited school of Radiologic Technology (Technical Training and/or Associates Degree)
• License/Certification/Registration
• Current Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification from American Red Cross or American Heart Association
• Current Registration with American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT)

Preferred Qualifications:
• License/Certification/Registration
• Additional certifications in Imaging
• ARRT CT Certification or successful completion within 18 months of hire
• Experience
• 1 or more years of experience as a CT Technologist or in a related role
• Experience with EPIC / Radiant
• Previous ambulatory care experience preferred

Additional Requirements:
• Understanding of current MN Dept of Health Regulations
• Knowledge of quality control and safety standards
• Strong interpersonal skills
